Replace.Text: Unique Aztec melee unit that replaces Swordsman. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking and -7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending. May capture defeated enemies, turning them into Builders. Ignores terrain movement cost in Jungle and Forest.

Aztec unique support unit available with the Mysticism Civic. Can be purchased with Faith. Adjacent Melee, Anti-Cavalry and Ranged units fight at full strength when damaged and earn Great General points from kills.
Arabian unique Classical Era unit. Gains additional +8 [ICON_Strength] when fighting on Desert or Plains.
Greek unique Ranged unit that replaces Archer. Stronger Ranged attack and Melee defence than Archer but with Range 1.

American unique Industrial Era unit that replaces Musketman. Weaker than Musketman, but cheaper to build and maintain and gains +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in or adjacent to its home territory. Also gains additional +5 [ICON_Strength] when fighting in Forest or Jungle.

Sumerian unique Ancient Era unit that replaces the Spearman. The Phalanx is available with the discovery of the Mining technology. +8 [ICON_Strength] if fighting within 8 tiles of a Ziggurat improvement.
Chinese unique Medieval Era Ranged unit that replaces Crossbowman. Slightly less strong than the Crossbowman, but can attack twice per turn.
Spanish unique Ranged unit that replaces Horseman. Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Faith] Faith on combat victory if fighting on same continent as capital.

Roman unique cavalry unit that replaces Rider. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting next to Legion or Warrior unit. Yields 33% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] as [ICON_Gold] on combat victory.
Russian unique cavalry unit that replaces Horseman. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength versus damaged units and +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against Melee units.

Norwegian unique Medieval Era Melee unit that replaces Swordsman. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Culture] Culture on combat victory if fighting on same continent as capital.
Indian unique Medieval Era Heavy Cavalry unit that replaces Knight. Ignores terrain costs. Heals +15 per turn when on or adjacent to a Stepwell improvement.

English unique Medieval Era Ranged unit that replaces the Crossbowman. +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against Melee and Cavalry units with a further +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if adjacent to another Longbowman unit.
Japanese unique unit available with the Feudalism Civic. Can be purchased with [ICON_Faith] Faith. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending.
Scythian unique Medieval Era Heavy Cavalry unit that replaces Knight. Can move after attacking.
Brazilian unique Industrial Era Melee unit that replaces the Rifleman. Cheaper than the Rifleman and costs less maintenance.
Egyptian unique Ranged unit that is stronger than the Archer it replaces.
French unique Medieval Era Heavy Cavalry unit that replaces Knight. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking.
Kongolese unique Information Era Melee unit that replaces Mechanized Infantry. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking or defending districts.

Brazilian unique Renaissance Era Recon unit that replaces the Ranger. Available earlier than the Hunter at Gunpowder. Can build forts. Yields 25% of defeated units' combat strength as [ICON_Gold] Gold and 25% of defeated units' combat strength as [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Spanish unique Renaissance Era Anti-Cavalry unit.
Indian unique Melee unit that replaces the Rifleman. Fights at full Combat Strength when damaged.
Scythian unique Ancient Era Recon unit that is stronger than the regular Scout.
German unique Tank replacement that has +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking.
Russian unique Tank replacement that costs less to build and less maintenance. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in or adjacent to own territory.
Japanese unique naval Ranged unit. Stronger than the Battleship it replaces.
Egyptian unique naval Ranged unit. Stronger than the Quadrireme it replaces and has range 2 instead of 1.
Roman unique siege unit. Stronger than the Catapult it replaces.
Sumerian unique Melee unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength versus damaged units.
Greek unique Melee unit that replaces Rifleman. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on Hills and ignores Hills movement penalty.
French unique Melee unit that replaces Musketman. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on foreign continents. Amphibious - no attack penalty when attacking from sea or across rivers.

Arabian unique Medieval Era Melee unit that replaces the Longswordsman. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when opponent is another religion. Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Faith] Faith on combat victory. Converts captured cities to player's religion. May be purchased with Faith.

Kongolese unique support unit replacing Medic but available earlier with the Mysticism Civic. Must be purchased with Faith. Heals units plus adjacent Melee, Cavalry, Anti-Cavalry and Ranged units yield 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Faith] Faith on combat victory.

Chinese unique support unit available with the Military Training Civic. Adjacent Melee, Cavalry, Anti-Cavalry and Ranged units get +5 Combat Strength and earn more experience. Must have a Barracks to build.

Spanish unique Renaissance Era unit that replaces the Musketman. +9 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when there is a Missionary, Inquisitor, or Apostle in the same hex. If this unit captures a city or is adjacent to a city when it is captured, the city will automatically adopt the Conquistador player's Religion as the dominant Religion.
Atomic Era Ranged unit. Cannot move and attack on the same turn. Gains +12 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged strength vs. land units (exluding Heavy Cavalry). Gains +1 [ICON_Range] Range when on hills.
Fast-moving Renaissance Era Recon unit. Ignores rivers when moving and has no disembark cost.
American unique Atomic Era Light Cavalry unit. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength versus Heavy Cavalry units.

English unique Renaissance Era Heavy Cavalry unit available with the Reformed Church Civic. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in or adjacent to own territory and +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when opponent is another religion.

Norwegian unique support unit available with the Mysticism Civic. Adjacent units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength versus undamaged units and +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength versus damaged units. Yield 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Faith] Faith if combat is won within one tile.
Modern Era Recon unit. Ignores rivers when moving and has no disembark cost.
Information Era Ranged unit. Cannot move and attack on the same turn. Gains +12 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged strength vs. land units (exluding Heavy Cavalry). Gains +1 [ICON_Range] Range when on hills.
Atomic Era Ranged Support unit. +10 Combat Strength when defending.
Indian unique Classical Era unit. Adjacent enemy units receive -5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on same continent as capital city.
+4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against Melee and Cavalry units.
+4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength next to Longbowman unit.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength next to Legion or Warrior unit.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength within 8 tiles of Ziggurat.
+8 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in Desert or Plains.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength outside of own borders.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in Forest or Jungle.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when opponent is another religion.

Row.Text: You look to machinery to improve the performance of your sizable contingent of ranged troops.
Clasical era melee unit that's effective against mounted units.
Renaissance era melee unit that's effective against mounted units.
Industrial era melee unit that's effective against mounted units.
Atomic era melee unit that's effective against mounted units.
Fast-moving Renaissance era light cavalry unit.
Fast-moving Modern era light cavalry unit
Fast-moving Atomic era light cavalry unit.
Hard-hitting, Clasical era heavy cavalry unit.
Hard-hitting, Renaissance era heavy cavalry unit.
Hard-hitting, Modern era heavy cavalry unit.
First bomber unit, available in the Modern era.
Future era bomber unit with stealth capability.
Future era Jet Fighter upgrade with stealth capability.
First ground attack unit, available in the Modern era.
Atomic era Great War Ground Attack upgrade.
Future era Jet Ground Attack upgrade with stealth capability.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending vs. anti-air.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. fighter class units.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. ground attack class units.
Fast Renaissance era melee naval unit.
Strongest melee naval unit. Reveals submarines within sight range.
Information era melee naval unit that can transport air units.
Medieval era heavy ranged naval unit.
Renaissance era heavy ranged naval unit.
Industrial era heavy ranged naval unit.
Cancel out bombard penalty against units.
Increase bombard by +17 for Heavy Naval Units.

Replace.Text: A mechanized weapons company, sometimes called a manoeuvre support company, is a company-sized military unit attached to an infantry battalion to support the rifle companies of the battalion. It usually possesses some combination of machine guns, automatic grenade launchers, mortars, anti-armor missiles, anti-aircraft missiles, reconnaissance troops (which usually includes snipers) and assault pioneers (infantrymen specially trained in the assault role). Traditionally these infantrymen are foot soldiers but from WW2 onwards they are mounted in either APCs or AFVs in mechanized infantry battalions.
Fast-moving Information era light cavalry unit.
You look to construction to improve the performance of your sizable contingent of ranged troops.
Indian unique Classical era unit that replaces the Cataphract. Adjacent enemy units receive -5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength.
Atomic era Great War Bomber upgrade.
Atomic era Great War Fighter upgrade.
Fast Medieval era exploration melee naval unit.
Modern era melee naval unit. Reveals submarines within sight range.
Modern era heavy naval ranged unit. Provides cover from air and nuclear attacks up to 1 tile away.
